alert.note: Alert for South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 18 at 4:40AM MST until February 18 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...HIGH WIND WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, west winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. For the High Wind Watch, west winds 40 to 50 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...South Laramie Range and South Laramie Range Foothills. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 9 AM MST this morning. For the High Wind Watch, from Saturday morning through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers, with a risk for blow overs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of blowing snow expected through tonight. Visibility will be reduced to one half mile at times.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
